basics.name: Jim Park
basics.label: Developer Operations Consultant
basics.summary: I've got DevOps on Vinyl. From the beginning of my career, I have focused on using technology to eliminate toil and get to "better value sooner safer happier".

work.summary: Provided technical leadership to adopting modern DevOps practices using AWS, containers, Datadog, Github, and other Cloud Native technologies.
highlights: Used Github Actions, AWS App Mesh (a service mesh technology), and AWS ECS to dynamically provide a deployed preview that can be used for QA whenever someone opens a pull request.
Developed a continuous deployment pipeline leveraging Github pull requests for managing the terraform lifecycle
Eliminated frivolous alerts for our oncall rotation by establishing and promoting standards.

work.position: Member of the Technical Staff - Head of Operations
work.summary: As the third hire at the newly formed CS Labs, I was responsible for establishing our Cloud infrastructure, both from a technical and business perspective. By applying my knowledge of modern operations practices with and through successful negotation with enterprise stakeholders, we were able to define operating parameters that permitted us the agility of a startup, but with the risk conscientiousness worthy of a multinational bank.
highlights: Projects could be thought up and an MVP could be stood up the same or next day.

work.summary: I was a technical leader for the CloudOps team, responsible for establishing the reference standards for deploying open source CloudFoundry by operating run.pivotal.io.
highlights: Built the first self-running, self-repairing and self-updating Cloud Foundry Platform as a Service for a Fortune 500 customer.
Updated 300+ container hosts running 50,000+ containers multiple times a week.
Collaborated with our technical writer team to publish our reference guide for monitoring CloudFoundry

work.summary: I was responsible for Wildbit's OpenIndiana and CentOS servers configured using Chef.
I was responsible for configuring our over one thousand servers using Puppet, incident response and data center operations.
I was responsible for configuring Juniper network devices and using puppet to automate the configuration of backend and client-side servers.
I was responsible for helping small business customers with configuring their LAMP stack servers and troubleshooting networking issues.
I was responsible for the creation and configuration of student computer labs.
I was responsible for repairing electronic equipment, including personal computers, servers and peripherals.
highlights: I took the initiative to analyze our part orders and build a repair parts cache, reducing the repair backlog from 3+ months to same day or next day for over 50% of new work orders in support of my unit in OIF II.
